EnglishScore: Foreign students are required to take the TOEFL or IELTS exam. The required minimum TOEFL score is 90 for the internet-based test. The required minimum IELTS score is 6.5, with no subsection below 6.

International applicants from non-English speaking countries are required to demonstrate proficiency in English by submitting scores from one of the following testing services: TOEFL, IELTS or Duolingo. The minimum required composite TOEFL iBT score is 80. The minimum required composite IELTS score is 6.5, with no subsection score below 6. The minimum required Duolingo score is 105.

All students whose native language is not English are required to demonstrate English proficiency. Acceptable tests include TOEFL iBT, IELTS, PTE, or Duolingo. The requirement may be waived if the applicant has received a degree from a U.S. college or university or from a university in another country where English is the official language of instruction.

International applicants whose native language is not English are required to take the TOEFL exam. A minimum score of 90 on the TOEFL iBT is required for admission. The Program in Public Health also accepts the IELTS exam. An overall score of 6.5 with no subsection below 6 is required.

All international students must demonstrate English proficiency. The Graduate School's minimum score for the internet-based TOEFL (iBT) is 80. The Graduate School's minimum IELTS score is 6.5 overall with no subsection below 6. The Graduate School's minimum Duolingo English Test (DET) score is 105. The Graduate School's minimum PTE Academic score is 53. This requirement is waived for applicants who have earned a degree from an institution in the United States or another English-speaking country.
Program name: Adult-Gerontology Acute Care Nurse Practitioner Certificate
Adult-Gerontology Acute Care Nurse Practitioner MSN

The minimum Duolingo English Test score for consideration is 115. The minimum PTE Academic score for consideration is 65.

The Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) is required for applicants whose native language is not English. A minimum score of 85 on the internet based test is required for admission. We also accept IELTS, with a minimum score of 6.5 overall with no subscore below 6.

International applicants whose native language is not English are required to take the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL). The minimum acceptable score is 550 for the paper based test and 85 (for PhD) for the internet-based test (iBT).

TOEFL, IELTS, or other English language test scores may be required for international applicants. The Graduate School requires a minimum TOEFL iBT score of 80, an IELTS overall score of 6.5 (with no subsection below 6), a Duolingo score of 105, or a PTE Academic score of 53 for most programs.

Applicants whose native language is not English are required to take an English proficiency exam. Stony Brook University accepts the following exams: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language), IELTS (International English Language Testing System), Duolingo English Test. The English proficiency exam is waived for students who have earned a degree from an institution in the United States or another English-speaking country.

All graduate applicants are required to demonstrate English proficiency. This requirement can be satisfied by one of the following: TOEFL: A minimum score of 80 on the internet based test (iBT). IELTS: A minimum overall score of 6.5, with no subsection score below 6. Duolingo English Test: A minimum score of 105.
Program name: Media Scoring and Production MM Online

EnglishScore: International applicants are required to have a minimum score on one of the following exams: TOEFL (iBT): 80, IELTS: 6.5 (with no band score below 6), Duolingo: 115, PTE Academic: 53.

Applicants must prove English proficiency by submitting scores from a recent (within two years) TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo English test. The PTE Academic test is also accepted. Applicants from countries where English is the official language of instruction are exempted from this requirement.

If your native language is not English, you must demonstrate English proficiency. You must take the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) or the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) test. Stony Brook University also accepts Duolingo English Test (DET) with a minimum score of 105 or Pearson Test of English (PTE Academic) with a minimum score of 53. You are exempt from this requirement if you: Have a bachelor's, master's, or doctoral degree from a U.S. college or university or a university in a TOEFL-exempt country.

All graduate applicants who are not native or primary speakers of English must demonstrate English proficiency. Minimum scores required for admission: TOEFL iBT: 80, IELTS: 6.5 overall band score with no band score below 6, PTE Academic: 53, Duolingo English Test: 105.

All graduate applicants who are not native or primary speakers of English must demonstrate English proficiency. Acceptable exams and the minimum scores for PhD programs are: TOEFL iBT score of 90, IELTS overall score of 6.5, Duolingo English Test score of 115, or PTE Academic score of 65.

All international students must demonstrate English proficiency. The Graduate School's minimum score for the TOEFL iBT is 80. The Graduate School's minimum score for the IELTS is 6.5 overall with no subsection below 6. The Graduate School's minimum score for the Duolingo English Test is 105. The Graduate School's minimum score for the PTE Academic is 53.

International applicants from non-English speaking countries must provide proof of English proficiency. Stony Brook University will accept the TOEFL iBT, the IELTS, the Duolingo English Test, and the PTE Academic to satisfy the English Proficiency requirement. Minimum scores are: TOEFL iBT 80, IELTS 6.5 overall band score with no band score below 6, Duolingo English Test 105, PTE Academic 53.

TOEFL scores are required for international applicants from countries in which English is not the primary language. The minimum TOEFL score for admission to the Graduate School is 550 (paper based) and 80 (internet based). Speaking section score of 22 or higher. The Graduate School at Stony Brook University also accepts IELTS and Duolingo English Test scores.
Program name: Molecular Cell and Developmental Biology PhD

EnglishScore: For international applicants, proof of English proficiency is required. The Graduate School accepts TOEFL iBT, IELTS, Duolingo English Test, and PTE Academic. The minimum TOEFL iBT score is 80. The minimum IELTS score is 6.5 overall with no subsection below 6.0. The minimum Duolingo score is 105. The minimum PTE Academic score is 53.

The TOEFL is required for international students whose native language is not English. As per the Stony Brook Graduate School, applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency by submitting scores from one of the following exams: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), or Duolingo English Test.

TOEFL scores (for international students). The Graduate School requires international students to demonstrate English proficiency via TOEFL iBT (minimum 90), IELTS (minimum 6.5 overall), Duolingo (minimum 115), or PTE Academic (minimum 65).

Applicants from non-English speaking countries are required to provide a score from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL). The Internet-based test (iBT) is required. A minimum total score of 90 on the iBT is required for admission. The International English Language Testing System (IELTS) is also accepted. A minimum overall score of 7 is required for admission.

For admission to the Graduate School, the following minimum scores are required: TOEFL (Internet-based test): 80, IELTS: 6.5 overall band with no band below 6.0, Duolingo English Test: 105, PTE Academic: 53.

All students whose native language is not English are required to demonstrate English proficiency. The Graduate School accepts the TOEFL iBT (minimum 80), IELTS (minimum 6.5), Duolingo (minimum 105), or PTE Academic (minimum 53).

International applicants must demonstrate proficiency in English. TOEFL or IELTS scores are required for most international applicants. Per the Graduate School, accepted exams include TOEFL iBT (minimum 80), IELTS (minimum 6.5 overall), Duolingo (minimum 105), and PTE academic (minimum 53).

For International Applicants: Please refer to the International Students page for additional requirements. The university accepts TOEFL iBT, IELTS, Duolingo, and PTE Academic tests to demonstrate English proficiency.

All international students must demonstrate English proficiency. The Graduate School accepts TOEFL (minimum 80 iBT), IELTS (minimum 6.5 composite, with no subsection below 6), Duolingo (minimum 105), and PTE Academic (minimum 53) scores.

All international students must demonstrate English proficiency by submitting scores from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) or the International English Language Testing System (IELTS).
Program name: Prevention Science and Community Health MS

EnglishScore: All graduate applicants whose native language is not English are required to take an English proficiency exam. Stony Brook University accepts the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), and Duolingo. The minimum acceptable composite score on the TOEFL iBT is 80. The minimum acceptable composite score on the IELTS is 6.5, with no subsection recommended to be below 6. The minimum acceptable score on the Duolingo English Test is 105.
Program name: Prevention Science and Community Health PhD

EnglishScore: For international applicants, proof of English proficiency is required. Accepted tests and minimum scores are: TOEFL iBT with an overall score of 85 (and at least 22 on the speaking sub-section), IELTS with an overall score of 6.5 (with no sub-score less than 6), or Duolingo with an overall score of 105.

All international students must demonstrate proficiency in English. The University requires a minimum score of 85 on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) Internet-based test, an overall score of 6.5 on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) exam, an overall score of 105 on the Duolingo English Test, or an overall score of 58 on the PTE Academic exam.
All international students must demonstrate English proficiency. Acceptable exams include TOEFL iBT, IELTS, PTE Academic, and the Duolingo English Test.
Program name: Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner Certificate

EnglishScore: TOEFL scores are required for all students for whom English is not their native language. Minimum score: 90.

All graduate applicants for whom English is not their native language are required to demonstrate English proficiency. The following are the minimum scores required for admission to the Graduate School: a minimum score of 80 on the TOEFL iBT, a minimum overall score of 6.5 on the IELTS (with no subsection score below 6.0), a minimum score of 53 on the PTE Academic, or a minimum score of 105 on the Duolingo English Test (DET).

All international students must demonstrate English proficiency by taking the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) or the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) exam. The minimum acceptable score for the TOEFL is 85 on the Internet-based test. The minimum acceptable overall score on the IELTS exam is 6.5, with no subsection score below 6. Stony Brook University's School of Professional Development is now accepting the Duolingo English Test. The minimum acceptable score is 105.

International applicants must also submit an official score of the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) or the International English Language Testing System (IELTS). A minimum TOEFL iBT score of 80 or an overall IELTS score of 6.5 with no subsection below 6.0 is required.

An official score of the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) is required. A minimum score of 80 on the Internet-based test is required. The TOEFL is not required for applicants who have earned a degree from a U.S. institution or from a country in which English is the official language.

All graduate applicants are required to demonstrate English proficiency. We accept the TOEFL iBT, the IELTS, and the Duolingo English Test. TOEFL iBT: overall score of 80. IELTS: overall score of 6.5, with no subsection score below 6. Duolingo English Test: minimum score of 105.

International applicants must also submit an evaluation of foreign transcripts from World Education Services (WES) and Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) or International English Language Testing System (IELTS) scores. The university's graduate school specifies the following minimum scores for applicants whose native or primary language is not English: TOEFL iBT: 80, IELTS (Academic): 6.5 overall with no subsection below 6.0, Duolingo: 105, PTE Academic: 53.

International applicants who are not native or primary speakers of English are required to submit an official score report from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), or the Duolingo English Test. The minimum score for the TOEFL internet-based test (iBT) is 80, and 550 for the paper-based test. The minimum overall score for IELTS is 6.5, with no subsection score below 6. The minimum score for the Duolingo English Test is 105.

International students must demonstrate English proficiency by submitting one of the following: TOEFL iBT (minimum score 80), IELTS (minimum overall score 6.5, with no subsection score below 6), Duolingo English Test (minimum score 105), or PTE Academic (minimum score 53). Applicants are exempt from submitting English proficiency scores if they have earned a bachelor’s or master's degree from an accredited U.S. institution or from a country on the approved list.

Stony Brook University requires international graduate applicants to demonstrate proficiency in English. The Graduate School accepts the TOEFL iBT (including the Home Edition), IELTS, Duolingo, and PTE Academic tests. The minimum score for master's programs is 80 on the TOEFL iBT, 6.5 overall on the IELTS, 105 on the Duolingo, and 53 on the PTE Academic.

ALL international applicants from non-English speaking countries must provide proof of English proficiency. This can be demonstrated by submitting official scores from at least one of the following testing agencies: TOEFL, IELTS, Duolingo, or PTE Academic. The minimum acceptable score for master's programs are: TOEFL iBT: 80; IELTS: 6.5 overall with no subsection below 6; Duolingo English Test: 105; PTE Academic: 53.

All graduate applicants are required to demonstrate English proficiency. This can be satisfied with minimum scores on TOEFL iBT (80 for master's), IELTS (6.5 overall), Duolingo (105 for master's), or PTE Academic (53 for master's). Students who have earned a degree in the U.S. or in a country that is exempt from the English proficiency requirement are not required to submit test scores.
Program name: Special Focus Area in Health Programs, Policies and Practice (MSW)

EnglishScore: International applicants are required to demonstrate English proficiency. The School of Professional Development requires a minimum TOEFL iBT score of 80. The Graduate School also accepts IELTS (minimum 6.5), Duolingo (minimum 105), and PTE Academic (minimum 53) to satisfy this requirement.
Program name: Teaching and Learning With Technology Certificate

EnglishScore: International applicants are required to take the TOEFL or IELTS examination.

An English proficiency test (TOEFL) is required for applicants for whom English is not their first language. As per the Graduate School's policy, this requirement can be met with a minimum TOEFL iBT score of 80, an IELTS overall score of 6.5, a Duolingo English Test score of 105, or a PTE Academic score of 53.
TOEFL iBT or IELTS: Required for international students whose native language is not English. TOEFL iBT 85 / IELTS 6.5

All international students must demonstrate English proficiency. The following are the acceptable exams and the minimum scores that SPD will accept: TOEFL IBT: 85; IELTS: 6.5 overall band score with no band score below 6.0; PTE Academic: 58; Duolingo English Test: 105. We will also accept an ELS Language Centers score of 112. This requirement is waived for applicants who have earned a degree from a university in the United States or another English-speaking country.
Required for international applicants. Accepted tests are TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo. Minimum scores are TOEFL iBT: 85, IELTS: 6.5 overall with no subsection below 6, or Duolingo: 105.

All international students must demonstrate English proficiency. TOEFL: The minimum acceptable score for the TOEFL iBT is 80 for master’s programs and 90 for doctoral programs. IELTS: The minimum acceptable score for the IELTS is an overall score of 6.5, with no subsection score below 6. Duolingo English Test: The minimum acceptable score for Duolingo is 105 for master’s applicants and 115 for doctoral applicants. PTE Academic: The minimum acceptable score for the PTE Academic test is 53 for master's applicants and 65 for doctoral applicants.
International applicants are also required to take the TOEFL exam.
